c1e355dc-4aab-419f-a96a-80b9c1dc3d29.description: The ECHO Foundations program consists of 10 courses that help learners develop tools necessary for advancing equity and diversity in all aspects of their personal and professional lives. The program courses consist of three learning activities: reading materials, engaging with ​media clips, and ​participating in a group ​discussion facilitated via Zoom. These activities reflect three ways we can learn and grow in DEI awareness – intellectual learning, emotional processing, and practicing skills.
c1e355dc-4aab-419f-a96a-80b9c1dc3d29.name: Equity Certificate Hosted Online (ECHO) Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: My Role in Equity and Diversity Work: This foundational course introduces learners to the core concepts around equity, diversity, and social justice. Key topics include foundational terminology, understanding our own identities, exploring bias and oppression, and how to work to be an ally and advocate in this work.

Navigating Challenging Conversations: This course addresses one of the most significant aspects of equity and diversity work: navigating challenging conversations. This course introduces skills in the following areas: noticing and naming our own triggers and activation, developing nuance in our understanding of our intentions, and developing empathy and active listening skills when we impact others.

Addressing Implicit Bias and Microaggressions: It is essential to recognize and address the presence of implicit bias and microaggressions in our everyday lives. This course exposes learners to the concept of implicit bias and how it produces microaggressions that can impact the classroom, work, and social environments, as well as skills to interrupt and address microaggressions.

Removing Barriers and Creating Access: Whether it's captioning, gender-neutral restrooms, rooms for silent prayer, curb cuts, or inclusive language, DEI work involves paying attention to how we design our classrooms, labs, offices, residence halls, work, curricula, and events to be as welcoming and inclusive as possible. In this course, learners engage critical concepts of collective access and are given opportunities to assess the inclusivity of their own spaces and policies.

Ableism & Disability Justice: Ableism and discrimination towards people with disabilities and disabled communities play out on the individual, cultural, and institutional levels in the U.S. and worldwide. In this course, learners will be introduced to the foundational frames and the nuance involved in fighting ableism and working for disability justice.

Challenging Classism: The impact of classism in our society leads to many barriers on our campus and in the broader community. Exploring classism is an essential part of understanding how wealth, status, and income are intertwined with social, cultural, and historical issues in the United States. Class and classism intersect with our identities and experiences, and challenging assumptions and biases about class is an essential step in creating positive change at the University.

Gender, Gender Identity, and Sexuality: In discussions of “diversity,” not everyone recognizes that gender identity, gender expression, and sexual orientation are important points of cultural difference that merit recognition and voice. This course offers an opportunity for learners to be introduced to 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two-Spirit, Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, Asexual+) identities and identify strategies they can employ to create a more open and welcoming climate.

Race, Racism, and White Supremacy: This course provides education about the concepts of race, racism, and white supremacy, historical and current facts, figures, and insight on resistance movements. This course also addresses the importance of talking about white privilege, white dominance, and white fragility as a way for white people to understand their own socialization and participation in systemic racism.

Religious and Spiritual Identities: For many people, religion and spirituality are deeply personal and create values that offer a sense of purpose and community. This course will explore how religious, spiritual, and humanist identities interact with other social identities and the power and privilege within historical and modern contexts.

Understanding and Addressing Gender-Based Oppression: The media makes it sound like gender equity has been achieved. What's the truth? In this interactive course, increase your knowledge of gender-based oppression and discuss how gender justice benefits everyone.

2cbfcdc6-71ae-45a0-9ea4-49afe176f386.description: The earner of this badge has a foundational geotechnical knowledge as applied to the fields of engineering and geology. The earner is aware of protecting the environment with geosynthetics, failure criterion for rock and soil, design and installation monitoring of helical piles and anchors, evolution of USACE Seepage barrier wall contracts, lessons from the Bingham Canyon slide – monitoring methods, and improving roadway performance by wicking geotextile to reduce soil moisture.
2cbfcdc6-71ae-45a0-9ea4-49afe176f386.name: University of Minnesota 67th Annual Geotechnical Engineering Conference

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the University of Minnesota 67th Annual Geotechnical Engineering Conference.

0883f8ef-1b23-4a5e-818a-11ed2399c97a.description: Earner has a fundamental understanding of value proposition design, knowledge of Lean LaunchPad concepts & tools: business model canvas & customer discovery, able to map stakeholder/customer ecosystem roles, requirements, & decision processes, determine solution adjustments required for product-market fit, develop commercialization roadmap naming key milestones & resources, determine size of potential market, assess competition, & select first target market, & pitch business concepts to funders.

882b57ec-6cef-4dc1-8ad7-74cfd25b8da0.name: Project Management 101

badge_template_activities.title: To earn a badge, students were required to take a test with score of 80% or better. The workshop outcomes are enabling students to: Define major characteristics of a project, be familiar with various formats of Work Breakdown Structure, understand Project Scheduling terminology such as critical path analysis, triple constraints, and slack. Know the difference between cost estimating and cost budgeting, as well as top-down and bottom-up estimates. Expose students to estimating and budget methods.

98302889-aa8f-4ccf-9d8c-a8dff94450a7.description: Badge earners have explored personal growth and wellbeing, whole systems leadership, organizational wellbeing, and transformational leadership through activities enabling them to: build resilience and reduce stress; assess personal, organizational, and team wellbeing; design and facilitate workplace wellbeing plans; promote teamwork, inclusivity, and diverse perspectives; apply approaches to reduce bias, improve collaboration and inclusion, and address difference and conflict in the workplace.
98302889-aa8f-4ccf-9d8c-a8dff94450a7.name: Wellbeing Leadership

b77f1dbf-1921-4277-80fa-94da70b520a5.description: The earner of this badge will be equipped with fundamental knowledge on precision liquid-applied coating processes, such as slot coating, coating liquid properties, and drying and associated stress development. For more information, contact Prof. Lorraine Francis, lfrancis@umn.edu.
b77f1dbf-1921-4277-80fa-94da70b520a5.name: Short Course on Precision Coating and Drying 2021

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the learner must attend all of the short course lectures and download the notes.  The learner is also encouraged but not required to ask questions during the Q&A segments.  Short course topics: Overview and basic phenomena, Liquid coating properties, Introduction to colloidal dispersions, Wetting fundamentals, Slot coating, Tensioned web over slot coating, Slide and curtain coating, Multilayer coating, Drying and microstructure, and Stress and stress-induced defects.

99c1e6c7-6ea3-41f7-8397-e2fd5a3cf2e6.description: Participants of this short course have gained the foundational knowledge and skils needed to meet the safety and security expectations of the patients, healthcare providers, and healthcare organizations that use medical devices. Lectures covered the following topics: network and data security in healthcare; cybersecurity regulations, industry standards, corporate policies and best practices; security by design in medical product development; and integrating product and enterprise risk.

The earner participated in a conference that covered past, present, and future of ground improvement; reuse of geotechnical waste material; soil-water-structure interactions; Edenville Dam failure; Yeager Airport slide of 2015; the importance of construction control; and recent case histories.

Recipients of this badge have demonstrated the ability to prepare a three-minute summary of their dissertation and explain the significance and implications of their research to a non-specialist audience. They are able to select a visual that represents their summary and present their research to a live audience within their own college and to a panel of judges who are not experts in their research.
88448273-6ab5-4474-bd16-163b4ae8eec6.name: 3-Minute Thesis: 2019 College-Level Competition

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare and deliver a 3-minute presentation of one's academic research with one static slide to a non-specialist audience.

c16c3248-a111-4159-8ebe-f14518e9b596.description: Through a combination of lectures and hands-on activities in these 2 workshops, participants are introduced to designing and sharing online maps using Esri’s ArcGIS Online software. Topics include preparing data for use, online data sources, map design, spatial analysis, and effective storytelling. Use this badge as evidence that you have been trained on introductory web GIS and storytelling skills.
c16c3248-a111-4159-8ebe-f14518e9b596.name: Geospatial Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 2 workshops, 5 hours total.  Complete a story map with at least one custom web map presented in the story. OR, write a 500-1000 word essay on how knowledge of ArcGIS Online and StoryMaps contribute to your field of study.

2e02ca16-e1e4-46ff-aafb-7844795116ec.description: The Certificate of Excellence in Business is a customizable certificate built on the expertise of Carlson Executive Education courses. Courses in this certificate have been selected by the recipient to meet their specific goals. Earning a Carlson Executive Education Certificate of Excellence demonstrates a commitment to both building business acumen and preparing for the next level of responsibility.
2e02ca16-e1e4-46ff-aafb-7844795116ec.name: Carlson Executive Education Certificate of Excellence in Business

badge_template_activities.title: Complete three courses from the Carlson Executive Education catalog within two years.

7035a329-fc86-4ca7-b275-dca916e63207.description: In an online 7-week Bootcamp, learners are introduced to principles of good practice in online learning & strategies for fostering community, communication & connection. Learners move from theory to practice by exploring frameworks for inquiry & engagement when designing the learner experience. Learners engage in practices within an online learning community & gain practice using a variety of multimedia applications to foster cognitive presence, social presence, & teaching presence online.
7035a329-fc86-4ca7-b275-dca916e63207.name: Online Learning Principles

badge_template_activities.title: At the end of this 7-Week Online Summer Bootcamp, Gold Badge Earners are able to: Discuss theories, models, and frameworks for designing and facilitating online learning. Design engaging learning experiences that foster cognitive and social presence. Integrate a variety of multimedia applications for differentiated learning experiences. Use emerging technologies to create media for teaching and learning online.

skills.name: Effective Practices in Online Instructional Design

52706b72-332e-4d6c-bbc3-7e70c8558016.description: The earner of this badge will be equipped with fundamental knowledge on precision liquid-applied coating processes, such as slot coating, coating liquid properties, and drying and associated stress development. For more information, contact Prof. Lorraine Francis, lfrancis@umn.edu.
52706b72-332e-4d6c-bbc3-7e70c8558016.name: Short Course on Precision Coating and Drying - September 2022

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the learner must attend all of the short course lectures and download the notes. The learner is also encouraged but not required to ask questions during the Q&A segments. Short course topics: Overview and basic phenomena, Liquid coating properties, Introduction to colloidal dispersions, Wetting fundamentals, Slot coating, Tensioned web over slot coating, Slide and curtain coating, Multilayer coating, Drying and microstructure, and Stress and stress-induced defects.

86763a15-cbf2-45dd-9ec1-0767c78be621.description: The earner participated in a 3-Minute Thesis (3MT) College-Level competition. Recipients of this badge have demonstrated the ability to prepare a three-minute summary of their dissertation and explain the significance and implications of their research to a non-specialist audience. They are able to select a visual that represents their summary and present their research to a live audience within their own college and to a panel of judges who are not experts in their research.
86763a15-cbf2-45dd-9ec1-0767c78be621.name: 3-Minute Thesis: 2020 College-Level Competition

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare and deliver a 3-minute presentation of one's academic research with one static slide to a non-specialist audience.

48bee262-edfd-466c-a568-869602270eb1.description: Badge earners have experienced a variety of evidence-based mindfulness-based stress reduction methods in a highly supportive learning environment. They explored research supporting the benefits of mindfulness meditation and learned how to: a) develop and sustain a personal mindfulness meditation practice; b) manage and mitigate stress; and c) enhance resilience through the application of mindfulness in everyday activities, including mindful eating, communication, and perspective taking.
48bee262-edfd-466c-a568-869602270eb1.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR)

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 6 of the 8 class sessions and attend the all-day retreat.
Complete the final course evaluation.

The 8-week MBSR program provides comprehensive training in developing and sustaining a mindfulness meditation practice. It is NOT a teacher training program and completing the course DOES NOT qualify the participant for teaching MBSR or any other mindfulness programming. Completion of the 8-week MBSR program is, however, a prerequisite for beginning a standardized MBSR teacher training program or certification process.

The 8-week MBSR program is 28.5 clock hours. Please contact your licensing board or accrediting body to determine if this program meets eligibility to receive continuing education units. A certificate of attendance will be awarded at the end of the program upon request. Please contact the Bakken Center's community relations office (mindprg@umn.edu) for more information.

0821fc4c-6adf-43cf-88b9-1434e82f18f8.description: The earner of this badge has completed a certificate program focused on Business Analysis. The earner understands how to gather and document business requirements and translate them into functional design specifications that can be executed by IT development teams. The earner has explored identifying business needs, specifications, requirements, and data modeling.
0821fc4c-6adf-43cf-88b9-1434e82f18f8.name: Online Business Analysis Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 60 contact hours of Online Business Analysis Certificate programs (equivalent to  continuing education credits).

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the learner must view all of the short course lectures and download the notes. The learner is also encouraged but not required to ask questions during the office hours. Short course topics: Overview and basic phenomena, Liquid coating properties, Introduction to colloidal dispersions, Wetting fundamentals, Slot coating, Tensioned web over slot coating, Slide and curtain coating, Multilayer coating, Drying and microstructure, and Stress and stress-induced defects.

0995a4c1-5a42-47ed-8867-2eb975317d3a.description: Earners of this badge are able to communicate to a wide range of individuals outside of their field. The earner is able to assess an audience, reflect on one’s own messages and adjust as appropriate, tailor a message and delivery method to the audience, topic, and purpose, critically analyze others’ messages, and develop awareness about posture, breath, voice, and eye contact and how they can be used to connect with audiences.
0995a4c1-5a42-47ed-8867-2eb975317d3a.name: Effective Communication to General Audiences

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate ability to communicate to a wide range of individuals outside of their field by assessing an audience, reflecting on one’s own messages and adjusting as appropriate, tailoring a message and delivery method to the audience, topic, and purpose, critically analyzing others’ messages, and developing awareness about posture, breath, voice, and eye contact to connect with audiences.

464a4bfd-b03f-417f-a99d-8641eb61ba15.description: In this 7-week online bootcamp, learners are introduced to principles of good practice in online learning and strategies for fostering community, communication, and connection. Learners move from theory into practice by exploring frameworks for inquiry and engagement when designing for the learner experience. Learners engage in authentic practices within an online community and gain practice using multimedia applications to foster cognitive presence, social presence, and teaching presence.
464a4bfd-b03f-417f-a99d-8641eb61ba15.name: Online Distance Learning

badge_template_activities.title: At the end of this 7-week online bootcamp, Gold Badge earners will be able to:  Discuss theories, models, and frameworks for designing and facilitating online learning.  Design engaging learning experiences that foster cognitive and social presence.  Integrate a variety of multimedia applications for differentiated learning experiences.  Use emerging technologies to create media for teaching and learning online.

a6675779-8f56-4e0f-86a9-9c3aa011fb62.description: The earner of this badge has foundational knowledge in geomechanics as applied to the fields of geotechnical engineering. The earner participated in a conference that covered liquefied strength using CPT, bearing capacity of footings on soft clay, reinforced slope failures, incremental rigidity method, understanding landslide activity using airborne lidar, owner vs. contractor discussion, and recent case histories.
a6675779-8f56-4e0f-86a9-9c3aa011fb62.name: University of Minnesota 69th Annual Geotechnical Engineering Conference

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the University of Minnesota 69th Annual Geotechnical Engineering Conference

500bfe2e-1ace-4bac-9b96-9bdbd192df4d.description: Through an asynchronous 3-week online workshop, learners engaged in dialogue and activities through Canvas and Slack during six 3-day modules. The workshop offered the following: Approximately 60 minutes of instructional videos and text authored by the instructor, approximately 180 minutes on readings, activities, and project assignments, 60 minutes of peer interaction, and a total of 5 hours per 3-day module.
500bfe2e-1ace-4bac-9b96-9bdbd192df4d.name: Instructional Design as Transferable Skills Gold Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Apply theories, models, and strategies for designing and developing instruction. Use a variety of multimedia applications for implementing learning solutions.
Design and develop a professional development module. Prepare evaluation surveys of their instructional design project for iterative improvement.

8ea5bd53-cfb3-4350-8357-6ef2850fd5ee.description: The earner of this badge has a foundational understanding of the preservation of cells as applied to the fields of recombinant cell biotechnology, cell banking, cell therapy, regenerative medicine, and cell-based assays. The earner is aware of regulatory issues in presernation, storage facilities, overall quality control and specifics related to the challenges of clinical cell processing with a focus on cryopreservation.
8ea5bd53-cfb3-4350-8357-6ef2850fd5ee.name: Preservation of Cellular Therapies

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Preservation of Cellular Therapies course.

c75d5e2b-36b7-42d9-834c-f0e4eb6d1b2c.description: The Certificate of Excellence in Strategy and Innovation includes high-level skills and practices for developing and executing successful business strategies. This certificate pathway is curated for maximum relevance in today's marketplace while maintaining the flexibility to address the recipient's specific goals. Earning a Carlson Executive Education Certificate of Excellence demonstrates a commitment to both building business acumen and preparing for the next level of responsibility.
c75d5e2b-36b7-42d9-834c-f0e4eb6d1b2c.name: Carlson Executive Education Certificate of Excellence in Strategy & Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete two core strategy and innovation courses from Carlson Executive Education.
Complete an elective Carlson Executive Education course.

701fd2a8-b29e-4251-9923-b771ea3ad059.description: Participants have acquired foundational knowledge in the techniques of preserving cellular therapies for clinical and academic use. Lecturers covered the fundamentals of preservation, protocol development, design of a storage facility, regulatory issues associated with the preservation of cell therapies and their clinical use.
701fd2a8-b29e-4251-9923-b771ea3ad059.name: BioCor Preservation of Cellular Therapies Short Course 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Participants participate in lectures to learn about current technology used to preserve cellular therapies and further their knowledge by engaging with the content and lecturers.

bb53312d-0ec5-4ba8-ae8c-0415153b870e.description: Through lecture and hands-on activities, students participated in two three-hour workshops focusing on developing personal leadership potential and gaining skills needed to work with people from vastly different cultures.
bb53312d-0ec5-4ba8-ae8c-0415153b870e.name: Cross Cultural Leadership Gold Badge

badge_template_activities.title: The workshop outcomes are to enable students to: reflect on their culture and values that shape their worldviews, create a vision for personal leadership to guide their work across cultures, understand concepts related to culture including awareness and spheres of competence, be familiar with mindfulness and creativity as principles for personal leadership, and explore six practices of personal leadership using Critical Moment Dialogue (CMD) to assess and navigate difficult experiences.

To demonstrate content knowledge, students completed the following deliverables to receive a digital badge at the highest level. 1. describe a difficult experience in a personal or professional setting 2. apply principles of CMD to process and discern the situation 3. reflect on what can or should be done to move forward 4. reflect on what can be learned from the experience for personal and professional growth

422c6142-ca1f-4372-90c9-9c9d2806dca0.description: The University District Civic Leadership Program is a collaboration between the University of Minnesota Office for Public Engagement, Office of Student Affairs and the Graduate School. Held fall 2020 through spring 2021, the mission is to build an effective partnership between the University District neighborhoods and the University of Minnesota through two main goals (see "Additional Details" link for more information).
422c6142-ca1f-4372-90c9-9c9d2806dca0.name: The University District Civic Leadership Program Gold Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Work on projects in teams to provide 20 hours of service per semester with University District neighborhoods. Projects included developing awareness of University neighborhoods adjacent to the UMN Minneapolis campus; implementing a racial equity framework for community engagement; creating a resource guide; develop a community calendar and strategy for implementation; and supporting events and programs to build community.
Participate and interact with community leaders through monthly forums on civic engagement topics to reflect on what community experience teaches us about larger issues in society.
Understand leadership in a place-based context.

2b491ccd-7478-43cc-9cfe-00dbcc2ba2a2.description: The earner of this badge has completed five executive education courses, compiled with Carlson Executive Education staff in order to achieve the business and leadership goals of the participant. Course work includes one course from the leadership core.
2b491ccd-7478-43cc-9cfe-00dbcc2ba2a2.name: Certificate of Distinguished Leadership and Business Administration

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 1 course from Carlson Executive Education's Leadership core.
Complete 4 of Carlson Executive Education's leadership and business courses.

8666c820-a8a1-4176-b1c9-214023971b53.description: Through lecture and hands-on activities, students participated in two 90-minute sessions focusing on the basic concepts of project management. Students are now able to: define major characteristics of a project, be familiar with various formats of Work Breakdown Structure, understand Project Scheduling terminology (such as critical path analysis, triple constraints, and slack), know the difference between cost estimating and cost budgeting, and expose students to estimating and budget methods.
8666c820-a8a1-4176-b1c9-214023971b53.name: Project Management Gold Badge

badge_template_activities.title: To demonstrate content knowledge, students completed three deliverables to receive the digital badge: 1. provide a scenario that includes project tasks, predecessors, successors, and time durations 2. prepare a Work Breakdown Structure and a preliminary Gantt chart depicting the schedule 3. prepare a cost estimate for the overall project using open source material

b93d809e-c4cb-41a6-b291-d42aa62b1154.description: The Advanced Certificate of Excellence in Business is a customizable certificate built on the expertise of Carlson Executive Education courses. Five courses in this certificate have been selected by the recipient to meet their specific goals. Earning a Carlson Executive Education Certificate of Excellence demonstrates a commitment to both building business acumen and preparing for the next level of responsibility.
b93d809e-c4cb-41a6-b291-d42aa62b1154.name: Carlson Executive Education Advanced Certificate of Excellence in Business

badge_template_activities.title: Complete five courses from the Carlson Executive Education catalog within two years.

Understand leadership in a place-based context.

28d8e248-0ead-4197-8872-597d774130c4.description: Participants in the Create Your Own Website workshop demonstrated the ability to design and develop websites that are: easy to navigate, accessible (equitable access to content), written for the way people read the web, communicate their scholarly and professional presence, and combine text, images and other elements to inform their audience, and gain and maintain their attention.
28d8e248-0ead-4197-8872-597d774130c4.name: Website Creation

badge_template_activities.title: To demonstrate the skills and knowledge described above, participants in this workshop used the necessary technology to design and develop a portfolio website using WordPress (themes, pages and posts, plugins, menus) and curating compelling images through searching for or creating them, and managing a media library.
Participants demonstrated their skills and knowledge by providing each other useful and constructive feedback on projects in process.

13a532fb-292d-47cb-900c-84263f2c3677.description: The Carlson General Management Program is a comprehensive development program from Carlson Executive Education, for senior-level leaders who are assuming enterprise-wide responsibilities. In this 6 month program, senior leaders polish their understanding of business strategy and acquire the soft skills required to lead in today’s environment of continuous disruption.
13a532fb-292d-47cb-900c-84263f2c3677.name: Carlson General Management Program

badge_template_activities.title: Module 1: Over two days, participants engage in in-person courses and discussions pertaining to Digital Transformation & AI; Demystifying Data Analytics; Leadership Agility; Business Strategy; and the Leadership Success Circle.
This two-hour live online session focuses on working with emotional intelligence.
Module 2: Over two days, participants engage in in-person courses and discussions pertaining to Enterprise/Global Collaboration; Inclusive Leadership; Executive Panel; and Financial Accountability.
This two-hour live online session focuses on executive presence.
Module 3: Over two days, participants engage in in-person courses and discussions pertaining to Customer Centricity; Leading Change; Business Ethics for Leaders; and Leading Peak Performance

671f8788-1dcf-4910-a30a-0e4ef6ae46c6.description: Badge earners have completed an introductory and experiential course designed to teach the practice of mindfulness. Mindfulness was presented and practiced as a formal daily meditation practice, and as an awareness practice with practical application in one’s everyday life. Badge earners have explored the research and possible benefits of mindfulness meditation and have learned the skills and approaches necessary to practice mindfulness on their own.
671f8788-1dcf-4910-a30a-0e4ef6ae46c6.name: Introduction to Mindfulness

a53a8cd9-4659-4832-ae11-9fd623d5bc8e.description: Through transformative courses, paired with executive coaching from experienced professionals, badge recipients learn a unique combination of the hard and soft skills required to lead in today’s environment of continuous disruption. Recipients learn how to effectively lead from the front and gain practical tools and frameworks to apply to challenges facing their organizations.
a53a8cd9-4659-4832-ae11-9fd623d5bc8e.name: Carlson Executive Leadership Certificate

Complete one additional Carlson Executive Education course of choice.

Carlson Executive Education coaches are world-renowned executives with years of expertise as thought leaders, consultants, and industry experts. They help leaders gain outside perspectives and diversity of thought to drive innovative thinking in a trusted, confidential relationship.

f5800dbd-4598-43c0-860c-90e32a8e66a7.description: The 2022 Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineering (IISE) North Central Regional Conference is a virtual conference connecting the top student and professional leaders from around the region. f5800dbd-4598-43c0-860c-90e32a8e66a7.name: 2022 IISE North Central Regional Conference
